pli-tv-pvr9:1.1: The Buddha laid down the training rules for his disciples for ten reasons:
pli-tv-pvr9:1.2: for the well-being of the Sangha, for the comfort of the Sangha, for the restraint of bad people, for the ease of good monks, for the restraint of corruptions in the present life, for avoiding corruptions in future lives, to give rise to confidence in those without it, to increase the confidence of those who have it, for the longevity of the true Teaching, and for supporting the training.
pli-tv-pvr9:2.1: That which is the excellence of the Order is the comfort of the Order.
pli-tv-pvr9:2.2: That which is the comfort of the Order is for the restraint of evil minded individuals.
pli-tv-pvr9:2.3: That which is for the restraint of evil minded individuals is for the living in comfort of well behaved monks …
pli-tv-pvr9:2.9: That which is for the maintenance of True _Dhamma_ is for the furthering of Discipline.
pli-tv-pvr9:3.1: That which is the excellence of the Order is the comfort of the Order.
pli-tv-pvr9:3.2: That which is the excellence of the Order is for the restraint of evil minded individuals …
pli-tv-pvr9:3.9: That which is the excellence of the Order is for the furthering of Discipline.
pli-tv-pvr9:4.1: That which is the comfort of the Order is for the restraint of evil minded individuals …
pli-tv-pvr9:4.8: That which is the comfort of the Order is for the furthering of Discipline.
pli-tv-pvr9:4.9: That which is the comfort of the Order is the excellence of the Order …
pli-tv-pvr9:5.8: That which is for the furthering of Discipline is the excellence of the Order …
pli-tv-pvr9:5.16: That which is for the furthering of Discipline is for the maintenance of True _Dhamma_.
